title: Part a. [0–3]
stimulusHtml:
3 points

1 point: For labeling the axes with appropriate values

1 point: For a smooth curve that begins with increasing v and is concave down

1 point: For a horizontal line near v = 0.50 m/s , beginning between t = 0.79 and 1.0 s
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

3 points

1 point: For labeling the axes with appropriate values

1 point: For a smooth curve that begins with increasing v and is concave down

1 point: For a horizontal line near v = 0.50 m/s , beginning between t = 0.79 and 1.0 s

The student response earns one of the following points:

3 points

1 point: For labeling the axes with appropriate values

1 point: For a smooth curve that begins with increasing v and is concave down

1 point: For a horizontal line near v = 0.50 m/s , beginning between t = 0.79 and 1.0 s

The student response earns two of the following points:

3 points

1 point: For labeling the axes with appropriate values

1 point: For a smooth curve that begins with increasing v and is concave down

1 point: For a horizontal line near v = 0.50 m/s , beginning between t = 0.79 and 1.0 s

The student response earns all of the following points:

3 points

1 point: For labeling the axes with appropriate values

1 point: For a smooth curve that begins with increasing v and is concave down

1 point: For a horizontal line near v = 0.50 m/s , beginning between t = 0.79 and 1.0 s

title: Part b. [0–4]
stimulusHtml:
4 points (i. 1 point; ii. 3 points)

i. 1 point: For a correct method of plotting position x as a function of time t

Examples

Plot the area under the velocity curve from part a. as a function of time.
x= ∫ vdt MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiEaiabg2 da9maapeaabaGaamODaiaadsgacaWG0baaleqabeqdcqGHRiI8aaaa @3CD1@
The slope of x as a function of t would yield the v versus t graph in part a.

ii. 3 points

1 point: For a smooth curve that begins with increasing x and is concave up for t < 0.79 s, ending between t = 0.79 s and 1.0 s

1 point: For a straight line with a positive slope, beginning between t = 0.79 s and 1.0 s

1 point: For a smooth transition of the curve from non-linear to linear in the region between t = 0.79 s and 1.0 s

title: Part c. [0–3]
stimulusHtml:
3 points

1 point: For using the graph to determine the distance traveled during the first part of the motion, beginning at t = 0 and ending somewhere between 0.79 s (when the glider and spring lose contact) and 2 s (the maximum time shown on the velocity graph

For calculating using the graph between 0 and 1.0 s,
d1 ≈ (2.9 large grid squares)(0.125 m/square) = 0.36 m
(1 square = 1.25 m/s x 0.5 s = 0.125 m)

1 point: For a correct expression indicating constant velocity during the last part of the motion
d 2 =vΔt=v( t−1.0s ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamizamaaCa aaleqabaGaaGOmaaaakiabg2da9iaadAhacqqHuoarcaWG0bGaeyyp a0JaamODamaabmaabaGaamiDaiabgkHiTiaaigdacaGGUaGaaGimai aadohaaiaawIcacaGLPaaaaaa@44C1@

1 point: For adding the two distances and solving for the time at which the glider hits the bumper

d 1 + d 2 =2.0m 0.36m+( 0.50m/s )( t−1.0s )=2.0m t= ( 2.0−0.36 )m 0.50m/s +1.0s=4.3s MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGceaqabeaacaWGKb WaaSbaaSqaaiaaigdaaeqaaOGaey4kaSIaamizamaaBaaaleaacaaI Yaaabeaakiabg2da9iaaikdacaGGUaGaaGimaiaad2gaaeaacaaIWa GaaiOlaiaaiodacaaI2aGaamyBaiabgUcaRmaabmaabaGaaGimaiaa c6cacaaI1aGaaGimaiaad2gacaGGVaGaam4CaaGaayjkaiaawMcaam aabmaabaGaamiDaiabgkHiTiaaigdacaGGUaGaaGimaiaadohaaiaa wIcacaGLPaaacqGH9aqpcaaIYaGaaiOlaiaaicdacaWGTbaabaGaam iDaiabg2da9maalaaabaWaaeWaaeaacaaIYaGaaiOlaiaaicdacqGH sislcaaIWaGaaiOlaiaaiodacaaI2aaacaGLOaGaayzkaaGaamyBaa qaaiaaicdacaGGUaGaaGynaiaaicdacaWGTbGaai4laiaadohaaaGa ey4kaSIaaGymaiaac6cacaaIWaGaam4Caiabg2da9iaaisdacaGGUa GaaG4maiaadohaaaaa@6D61@

ALTERNATE SOLUTION

1 point: For using the given information about the spring compression and the time at which the glider loses contact with the spring to arrive at t1 = 0.79 s at
d1 = 0.25 m
d2 = 2.0 m – 0.25 m = 1.75 m

1 point: For a correct expression indicating constant velocity during the last part of the motion

t2 = d2 / v = 1.75 m / 0.50 m/s = 3.5 s

1 point: For adding the two times
t = t1 + t2 = 0.79 s + 3.5 s
t = t1 + t2 = 4.29 s

d 2 =vΔt=v( t−1.0s ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamizamaaCa aaleqabaGaaGOmaaaakiabg2da9iaadAhacqqHuoarcaWG0bGaeyyp a0JaamODamaabmaabaGaamiDaiabgkHiTiaaigdacaGGUaGaaGimai aadohaaiaawIcacaGLPaaaaaa@44C1@

ALTERNATE SOLUTION

1 point: For using the given information about the spring compression and the time at which the glider loses contact with the spring to arrive at t1 = 0.79 s at
d1 = 0.25 m
d2 = 2.0 m – 0.25 m = 1.75 m

1 point: For a correct expression indicating constant velocity during the last part of the motion

t2 = d2 / v = 1.75 m / 0.50 m/s = 3.5 s

1 point: For adding the two times
t = t1 + t2 = 0.79 s + 3.5 s
t = t1 + t2 = 4.29 s
